events.summary: In March 2025, the U.S. House of Representatives passed a censure resolution against Democrat Al Green after he interrupted President Donald Trump during a joint session of Congress. Green was forcibly removed from the session after shouting "he has no mandate" while waving a walking cane. The censure, introduced by Republican Dan Newhouse, was supported by all Republicans and 10 Democrats. This was the only censure to pass in 2025, amidst a year marked by numerous censure attempts.

events.summary: Former President Donald Trump has called on Republican senators to eliminate the filibuster rule in the U.S. Senate. The filibuster allows a minority of senators to block legislation, and Trump argues that removing it would prevent government shutdowns and facilitate the passage of the Republican legislative agenda. Despite Trump's urging, Republicans have been hesitant to scrap the rule, as it could disadvantage them if they lose the majority in the future. Trump's comments come as he seeks to advance his party's priorities before the upcoming midterm elections.

events.why_relevant: The call to end the filibuster could significantly alter legislative processes and power dynamics in the U.S. Senate.

events.summary: The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has finalized revisions to the Taconite Federal Implementation Plan, setting new nitrogen oxide (NOx) and sulfur dioxide (SO2) emission limits for five taconite facilities in Michigan and Minnesota. events.summary: The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has revoked the 2024 rule that amended the reclassification of major sources as area sources under Section 112 of the Clean Air Act. This action follows a Congressional Review Act resolution disapproving the 2024 rule, which had required certain sources to comply with major source emission standards even after reclassification. The revocation restores the 2020 rule, allowing sources to reclassify without adhering to major source standards. This final rule is effective January 2, 2026.
events.title: EPA Revokes 2024 Rule on Reclassification of Major Sources
events.why_relevant: This action impacts regulatory compliance for hazardous air pollutants, affecting environmental standards and industry operations.

events.summary: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has revoked the Emergency Use Authorizations (EUAs) for Pfizer Inc.'s Lucira by Pfizer COVID-19 & Flu Test and Lucira by Pfizer COVID-19 & Flu Home Test. events.summary: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has determined that MYSOLINE (primidone) suspension, 250 mg/5 mL, was withdrawn from sale due to safety concerns, specifically potential microbial contamination. Consequently, the FDA will not accept or approve abbreviated new drug applications (ANDAs) for this product. This decision follows a citizen petition and a review of agency records and literature. The drug will be removed from the Orange Book's list of approved drug products.

events.summary: The General Services Administration (GSA) has announced updated mileage reimbursement rates for privately owned vehicles (POVs) for calendar year 2026. events.summary: The General Services Administration (GSA) has issued a notice revising the minimal value of foreign gifts and decorations to $525.00, effective January 1, 2026. This adjustment reflects an 8.99% increase based on the Consumer Price Index over the past three years. The revision cancels the previous FMR Bulletin B-54 and updates the guidelines for handling foreign gifts and decorations under 5 U.S.C. 7342 and FMR Part 102-42.
